Uses of Class
ej.microui.io.Image

Packages that use Image
ej.microui.io   
 

Uses of Image in ej.microui.io
 

Methods in ej.microui.io that return Image
static Image Image.createImage(byte[] imageData, int imageOffset, int imageLength, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immmutable image from a byte array for the default display.
The effect is identical to
createImage(Display.getDefaultDisplay(), imageOffset, imageLength, imageFormat);
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, byte[] imageData, int imageOffset, int imageLength, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immmutable image from a byte array for the given display.
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, java.io.InputStream stream, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immutable image from an InputStream.
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, int[] argbData, int offset, int scanlength, int width, int height, boolean processAlpha)
          Creates an immutable image from an int array of pixels for the specified display.
Each pixel value is stored in 0xAARRGGBB format, where the high-order byte contains the alpha channel and the remaining bytes contain color components for red, green and blue, respectively.
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, int width, int height)
          Creates a new mutable image for the given display and with the given size.
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, java.lang.String name, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immutable image from a resource for the given display.
static Image Image.createImage(Image source)
          Returns an immutable image from another image.
static Image Image.createImage(Image image, int x, int y, int width, int height)
          Creates an immutable image from another image zone.
static Image Image.createImage(java.io.InputStream stream, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immutable image from an InputStream.
The effect is identical to
createImage(Display.getDefaultDisplay(), stream, imageFormat);
static Image Image.createImage(int[] argbData, int offset, int scanlength, int width, int height, boolean processAlpha)
          Creates an immutable image from an int array for the default display.
The effect is identical to
createImage(Display.getDefaultDisplay(), argbData, offset, scanlength, width, height, processAlpha);
static Image Image.createImage(int width, int height)
          Creates a new mutable image for the default display and with the given size.
The effect is identical to
createImage(Display.getDefaultDisplay(), width, height);
static Image Image.createImage(java.lang.String name, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immutable image from a resource for the default display.
The effect is identical to
createImage(Display.getDefaultDisplay(), name, imageFormat);
 Image FlyingImage.getImage()
          Returns the image associated to the FlyingImage.

          Checks for a collision between this Image and the specified Image.

          Checks for a collision between this Image and the specified Image.

          Returns an immutable image from another image.

          Creates an immutable image from another image zone.
 void GraphicsContext.drawDeformedImage(Image img, int x, int y, int[] xys, int anchor)
          Draws a deformed image at the given anchor point.
The image anchor point is at position (x,y).
 void GraphicsContext.drawImage(Image img, int x, int y, int anchor)
          Draws an image at the given anchor point.
The image anchor point is at position (x,y).
 void GraphicsContext.drawRegion(Image src, int x_src, int y_src, int width, int height, int x_dest, int y_dest, int anchor)
          Draws the specified region of an image.
